Metadata: Effects of interdecadal climate variability on the oceanic ecosystems of the NE Pacific

The authors of this review characterize the effects of interdecadal climate forcing on the oceanic ecosystems of the NE Pacific Ocean. They discuss a number of recent studies relating climate to marine ecosystem dynamics with focus on primary and secondary producers, forage species, and several levels of predators. Together these studies reveal how decadal-scale climate forcing may affect the large oceanic ecosystems of the NE Pacific.
